title: Coinbase confirms insider breach linked to leaked support tool screenshots
summary: Coinbase has confirmed an insider breach where an employee leaked screenshots of its customer support tool, which contained sensitive customer information. The breach was discovered when screenshots began circulating on social media, raising concerns about data security and customer privacy. Coinbase promptly investigated the incident, identifying the insider responsible and taking appropriate action to prevent future breaches. The company assured customers that no personal financial information was compromised. This incident underscores the ongoing challenges in securing digital platforms and maintaining trust in online financial services.

title: Hackers exploit critical React Native Metro bug to breach dev systems
summary: Hackers have been exploiting a critical vulnerability in React Native's Metro, a popular development server used by software developers, to gain unauthorized access to development systems. The flaw allows attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely by taking advantage of a weakness in the Metro's handling of JavaScript modules, posing significant security risks to software projects relying on this tool. This breach highlights the importance of maintaining security vigilance and updating development environments to patch such vulnerabilities promptly. title: ✍️ The Bill to Hand Parenting to Big Tech | EFFector 38.2
summary: The article from EFFector discusses a proposed bill that would significantly increase the role of big tech companies in parenting by imposing strict controls over digital content to protect children online. It criticizes the bill for shifting responsibility from parents to tech giants, arguing that it could lead to widespread censorship and limit access to valuable information. title: Nvidia’s Campaign to Sell AI Chips to China Finally Pays Off
summary: Nvidia has successfully capitalized on the demand for artificial intelligence (AI) chips in China, despite ongoing trade tensions and U.S. government restrictions. By modifying its high-performance chips to comply with export controls, Nvidia has managed to penetrate the lucrative Chinese market, establishing itself as a leading supplier of AI technology. This strategic adaptation has resulted in significant business growth, highlighting the global appetite for AI advancements and showcasing Nvidia's ability to navigate and thrive in a complex geopolitical landscape.
source: Center for Security and Emerging Technology

title: Microsoft rolls out native Sysmon monitoring in Windows 11
summary: Microsoft has integrated native Sysmon-like capabilities into Windows 11, enhancing the operating system’s built-in security features. This development allows users to monitor and log system activities without needing separate third-party tools like the previously popular Sysmon from Microsoft’s Sysinternals suite. With this update, Windows 11 aims to provide improved security and transparency by enabling more comprehensive tracking of system operations, helping users and administrators detect suspicious activities and potential security threats more effectively. This move aligns with Microsoft's broader strategy to bolster security
